name: reducible
content:

able to be made simpler, or smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.: Some risks are reducible, others are in the hands of fate. The name Cassandra is reducible to "Sandy" and Lucinda to "Cindy".
More examplesFewer examplesSome problems of ageing are socially and psychologically constructed and may be reducible.The world of experience is reducible to a few basic laws.Empedocles argued that everything was fundamentally reducible to the elements earth, water, air and fire.
